pr_title: [#1732] Use timeout to wait for disposition update

timeline.message:
[#1732] Use timeout to wait for disposition update

AMQP adapter now uses timeout to wait for a disposition update
in response to a command sent to the device.

fixes #1732

Signed-off-by: Alfusainey Jallow <alf.jallow@gmail.com>

timeline.author: calohmn
calohmn

timeline.bodyText: The case that the deliveryUpdateTimeout  is 0 should be taken into account here. That would lead to an IllegalArgumentException in vertx.setTimer(). How about adding a check for that here and using null as timerId in that case (like it is done in AbstractSender.sendMessageAndWaitForOutcome) and further down adding a null check around vertx.cancelTimer(timerId);.
timeline.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText:
The case that the deliveryUpdateTimeout is 0 should be taken into account here

how about only allowing values > 0 for this config property?
replies.author: Alfusainey

replies.bodyText: I would rather keep it in line with the handling of the sendMessageTimeout value (and e.g. connection requestTimeout) and allow 0 for an infinite timeout.
replies.author: calohmn

timeline.bodyText:
I'm wondering whether the name of the property (deliveryUpdateTimeout) isn't a bit too technical here.
The corresponding property for waiting for a disposition update when the adapter sends a message downstream to the AMQP messaging network is called sendMessageTimeout.
While I think it is indeed good to have a separate property for the other direction (adapter to device), maybe we could align the naming somewhat. Maybe sendMessageToDeviceTimeout?
In any case, the property should also be documented here:
https://www.eclipse.org/hono/docs/admin-guide/amqp-adapter-config/#service-configuration
timeline.author: calohmn

timeline.bodyText: A check is needed here whether the timeout has already occurred, skipping the delivery update handling below in that case.
